chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
y: list nat
x: list nat

Goal:
f_s (x ++ y) = f_s x ++ f_s y

Premises:
f_s = fix f_s (x : string nat) : string bool := match x with | [] => [] | a :: x0 => to_bitstring a ++ [false] ++ f_s x0 end : string nat -> string bool
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
rev_app_distr : forall (A : Type) (x y : list A), rev (x ++ y) = rev y ++ rev x
app_inj_tail : forall (A : Type) (x y : list A) (a b : A), x ++ [a] = y ++ [b] -> x = y /\ a = b
app_eq_unit : forall (A : Type) (x y : list A) (a : A), x ++ y = [a] -> x = [] /\ y = [a] \/ x = [a] /\ y = []
in_elt_inv : forall (A : Type) (x y : A) (l1 l2 : list A), x el l1 ++ y :: l2 -> x = y \/ x el l1 ++ l2
app_comm_cons : forall (A : Type) (x y : list A) (a : A), a :: x ++ y = (a :: x) ++ y
in_split : forall (X : Type) (a : X) (x : list X), a el x -> exists y z : list X, x = y ++ [a] ++ z
derivable_ind : forall (X : Type) (P : stack X) (P0 : string X -> string X -> Prop), (forall x y : list X, (x, y) el P -> P0 x y) -> (forall (x y : list X) (u v : string X), (x, y) el P -> derivable P u v -> P0 u v -> P0 (x ++ u) (y ++ v)) -> forall s s0 : string X, derivable P s s0 -> P0 s s0
derivable_sind : forall (X : Type) (P : stack X) (P0 : string X -> string X -> SProp), (forall x y : list X, (x, y) el P -> P0 x y) -> (forall (x y : list X) (u v : string X), (x, y) el P -> derivable P u v -> P0 u v -> P0 (x ++ u) (y ++ v)) -> forall s s0 : string X, derivable P s s0 -> P0 s s0
list_prefix_inv : forall (X : Type) (a : X) (x u y v : list X), ~ a el x -> ~ a el u -> x ++ a :: y = u ++ a :: v -> x = u /\ y = v
Inductive derivable (X : Type) (P : stack X) : string X -> string X -> Prop := der_sing : forall x y : list X, (x, y) el P -> derivable P x y | der_cons : forall (x y : list X) (u v : string X), (x, y) el P -> derivable P u v -> derivable P (x ++ u) (y ++ v) Arguments derivable {X}%type_scope Arguments der_sing {X}%type_scope _ (_ _)%list_scope Arguments der_cons {X}%type_scope _ (_ _)%list_scope
app_cons_not_nil : forall (A : Type) (x y : list A) (a : A), [] <> x ++ a :: y
remove_app : forall (A : Type) (eq_dec : forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) (x : A) (l1 l2 : list A), remove eq_dec x (l1 ++ l2) = remove eq_dec x l1 ++ remove eq_dec x l2
split_inv : forall (X : Type) (u z x y : list X) (s : X), u ++ z = x ++ s :: y -> ~ s el u -> exists x' : list X, x = u ++ x'
MPCPb = fun '(x, y, P) => exists A : stack bool, A <<= (x, y) :: P /\ x ++ tau1 A = y ++ tau2 A : card bool * stack bool -> Prop
MPCP = fun '(x, y, P) => exists A : stack nat, A <<= (x, y) :: P /\ x ++ tau1 A = y ++ tau2 A : card nat * stack nat -> Prop
f_equal_nat : forall (B : Type) (f : nat -> B) (x y : nat), x = y -> f x = f y
concat_cons : forall (A : Type) (x : list A) (l : list (list A)), concat (x :: l) = x ++ concat l
List.in_split : forall (A : Type) (x : A) (l : list A), x el l -> exists l1 l2 : list A, l = l1 ++ x :: l2
Relation_Operators.Desc_ind : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> Prop), P [] -> (forall x : A, P [x]) -> (forall (x y : A) (l : list A), Relation_Operators.clos_refl A leA x y -> Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (l ++ [y]) -> P (l ++ [y]) -> P ((l ++ [y]) ++ [x])) -> forall l : list A, Relation_Operators.Desc A leA l -> P l
nthe_app_l : forall (X : Type) (x : X) (n : nat) (A B : list X), nthe n A = Some x -> nthe n (A ++ B) = Some x
ArithRing.nat_morph_N = {| Ring_theory.Smorph0 := eq_refl; Ring_theory.Smorph1 := eq_refl; Ring_theory.Smorph_add := Nnat.N2Nat.inj_add; Ring_theory.Smorph_mul := Nnat.N2Nat.inj_mul; Ring_theory.Smorph_eq := fun (x y : BinNums.N) (H : BinNat.N.eqb x y = true) => let H0 : forall n m : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.eqb n m = true -> n = m := fun n m : BinNums.N => match BinNat.N.eqb_eq n m with | conj x0 _ => x0 end in let H1 : x = y := H0 x y H in eq_ind_r (fun x0 : BinNums.N => BinNat.N.to_nat x0 = BinNat.N.to_nat y) eq_refl H1 |} : Ring_theory.semi_morph 0 1 Nat.add Nat.mul eq BinNums.N0 (BinNums.Npos Bin...
Inductive Desc (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) : list A -> Prop := d_nil : Relation_Operators.Desc A leA [] | d_one : forall x : A, Relation_Operators.Desc A leA [x] | d_conc : forall (x y : A) (l : list A), Relation_Operators.clos_refl A leA x y -> Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (l ++ [y]) -> Relation_Operators.Desc A leA ((l ++ [y]) ++ [x]) Arguments Relation_Operators.Desc _%type_scope _%function_scope _%list_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.d_nil _%type_scope _%function_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.d_one _%type_scope _%function_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.d_conc _%type_scope _%function_scope _ _ _%list_scope
BinInt.Z.lt = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.lt (_ _)%Z_scope
Inductive clos_refl (A : Type) (R : Relation_Definitions.relation A) (x : A) : A -> Prop := r_step : forall y : A, R x y -> Relation_Operators.clos_refl A R x y | r_refl : Relation_Operators.clos_refl A R x x Arguments Relation_Operators.clos_refl _%type_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.r_step _%type_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.r_refl _%type_scope
Forall2_cons : forall (A B : Type) (R : A -> B -> Prop) (x : A) (y : B) (l : list A) (l' : list B), R x y -> Forall2 R l l' -> Forall2 R (x :: l) (y :: l')

```coq
induction x.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite IHx. auto.
Qed.```
